greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T read by diagonals: T(i,j)=number of lines passing through (0,0) and at least one other lattice point (h,k) satisfying 0<=h<=i, 0<=k<=j.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
formula: T(i, j) = 2 + Sum_{g=1..min(i,j)} floor(i/g) * floor(j/g) * mu(g) for i > 0, j > 0.
T(i, j) = signum(i) + signum(j) + A135646(i, j).
mathematica: a[0, 0] = 0; a[0, _] = a[_, 0] = 1; a[i_, j_] := Module[{slopes, cnt}, slopes = Union @ Flatten @ Table[k/h, {h, 1, i }, {k, 1, j }]; cnt[ slope_] := Count[Flatten[Table[{h, k}, {h, 1, i }, {k, 1, j }], 1], {h_, k_} /; k/h == slope]; Count[cnt /@ slopes, c_ /; c >= 1] + 2]; Table[a[i-j, j], {i, 0, 12}, {j, 0, i}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 03 2017 *)
program: for (i=0, 10, for(j=0, 10, print1(T(i,j), ", ")); print); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 17 2017
T(i,j) = sum(h=0, i, sum(k=0, j, gcd(h,k) == 1)); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 17 2017
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
